title: Mimic Beta
description: Join the Beta test for the online multiplayer survival horror game Mimic by Ryan Laley Games.
longDescription:
<!--textBlock-->
<!--title-->
# Who Can you Trust?
<!--text-->
Dive into the heart-pounding depths of Mimic, an intense online multiplayer survival horror experience set aboard the doomed spaceship, the Icarus. With 5 players in matchmaking and up to 8 in private lobbies, collaboration is key as you and your fellow survivors strive to flee the clutches of impending doom.

Beware the insidious presence of the Mimic, an alien entity masquerading as one of your own. As tension mounts, the ship hurtles toward destruction on a collision course with the sun, while relentless killer maintenance droids prowl the corridors, seeking to eradicate any trace of the alien threat.

In a game of strategic deceit, players wield the power to influence the android's pursuit, sabotage escape efforts, and sow chaos amongst the ranks. Trust becomes a scarce commodity as you discern friend from foe amidst the mayhem.

As part of the crew, your objective is clear: repair the escape shuttle and flee the crumbling vessel. But unlocking security access and evading the murderous androids prove formidable obstacles on the path to salvation. Success hinges on identifying and expelling the Mimic from your midst before it's too late.

Yet, lurking among your ranks is a corporate agent, operating covertly to fulfill their own clandestine agenda. With hidden objectives and a sinister mandate, their presence adds a layer of intrigue and betrayal to an already precarious situation.

Unveil the true nature of the Mimic as it reveals itself to feed and perpetuate its existence. With survival as the ultimate prize, will you trust your instincts or succumb to the darkness that threatens to consume you all?

<!--textBlock-->
<!--title-->
# Player Roles
<!--text-->
**The Crew**
As part of the crew, your objective is clear: repair the escape shuttle and flee the crumbling vessel. But unlocking security access and evading the murderous androids prove formidable obstacles on the path to salvation. Success hinges on identifying and expelling the Mimic from your midst before it's too late.

**The Agent**
Lurking among your ranks is a corporate agent, operating covertly to fulfil their own clandestine agenda. With hidden objectives and a sinister mandate, their presence adds a layer of intrigue and betrayal to an already precarious situation

**The Mimic**
The Mimic is disguised as a human but may reveal their selves at any time to feed and lay their eggs. Their sole desire to escape the ship alive.

<!--textBlock-->
<!--title-->
# Surviving the Icarus
<!--text-->
The Icarus is a ship on collision course with the nearby sun. As it hurtles towards its end, solar flares rock the ship and trigger explosions.

Stalking the hallways of the Icarus are its service Droids who have been instructed to kill indiscriminately and ensure the destruction of the Mimic creature

<!--textBlock-->
<!--title-->
# Key Features
<!--text-->
**Public Matchmaking and Private Lobbies**
In public matchmaking the rules are set, but in a private lobby anything goes. Want you to be joined by up to 7 other friends? Want 3 Droids? 4 Mimics? Everlasting fire spreading damage? The rules are made by you so go crazy and have fun in a private lobby.

**Explore the Icarus**
Find Mementos, audio logs, testimonies and reports to discover the truth about the Icarus and its crew and discover the source of the Mimic creature.

**Vote to Survive**
At terminals around the ship, you can cast your vote to send commands to the AI android roaming the halls to target a specific player. Don't trust someone? Send the android to do your dirty work.

<!--textBlock-->
<!--title-->
# WARNING: PHOTOSENSITIVITY/EPILEPSY SEIZURES - READ THIS NOTICE BEFORE PLAYING
<!--text-->
A very small percentage of people may experience epileptic seizures or blackouts when exposed to certain kinds of flashing lights or light patterns. These persons, or even people who have no history of seizures or epilepsy, may experience epileptic symptoms or seizures while playing video games. If you or any of your relatives has an epileptic condition or has had seizures of any kind, consult your physician before playing any video game.

IMMEDIATELY DISCONTINUE use and consult a physician if you or your child experience any of the following symptoms: dizziness, altered vision, eye or muscle twitching, involuntary movements, loss of awareness, disorientation, or convulsions. Parents should watch for or ask their children about the above symptoms.

You may reduce risk of photosensitive epileptic seizures by taking the following precautions: sit farther from the screen, use a smaller screen, play in a well-lit room, do not play when you are drowsy or fatigued.
